title: 104_s1107
content: The Act may be cited as the "Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995" and extends COBRA continuation coverage. The "Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995" amends the Public Health Service Act to include a qualifying event involving a substantial reduction or elimination of a retiree group health plan. This allows qualified beneficiaries to become entitled to benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995 amends the Public Health Service Act to include a qualifying event involving a substantial reduction or elimination of group health coverage for a qualified beneficiary. This expands the definition of qualified beneficiary to include covered employees in the case of plan changes or termination. The Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995 expands the definition of a qualified beneficiary to include covered employees who had retired before a substantial reduction or elimination of coverage, as well as spouses, dependent children, or surviving spouses of the covered employee. This amendment also affects the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995 broadens the definition of a qualified beneficiary to include retirees, spouses, and dependents affected by a substantial reduction or elimination of group health plan coverage. This amendment impacts the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 by specifying the qualifying event and entitlement to benefits under the Social Security Act. The Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995 expands the definition of a qualified beneficiary to include retirees, spouses, and dependents affected by changes or termination of health plan coverage. Amendments are made to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to address the period of coverage and definitions related to entitlement to benefits. The Retiree Continuation Coverage Act of 1995 expands the definition of a qualified beneficiary to include retirees, spouses, and dependents affected by changes or termination of health plan coverage. Amendments are made to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to address the period of coverage and definitions related to entitlement to benefits. Additionally, the act introduces a new subclause regarding qualifying events involving substantial reduction or elimination of a retiree group health plan, specifying the date when a covered qualified beneficiary becomes entitled to benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding termination with respect to a qualified beneficiary. The Act will be effective as of January 1, 1995.
